tier_mapping_methodology.note: BRSR reports do not explicitly provide tier breakdowns. Proxy mapping used:

tier_2_3_4_aggregated_management.note: Cannot disaggregate into Tier 2, 3, 4 without additional data

obj_1_representation_analysis.objective: Distribution of men vs. women at each hierarchical level
obj_1_representation_analysis.key_insight: GAIL has VERY LOW female representation at ALL levels: Entry (3.23%), Management (7.0%), C-Suite (0%), Board (7.14%)

entry_to_junior_management.status: REVERSE PIPELINE - Women INCREASE from entry to management (rare pattern!)

obj_2_progression_leaky_pipeline.key_insight: UNIQUE PATTERN: Women INCREASE from entry (3.23%) to management (7.0%), suggesting senior female hires, but still blocked at C-Suite (0%)

calc_2_pipeline_flow_ratio.description: Measures how well women progress from entry to top

alternative_calculation_board.interpretation: Board has HIGHER female % than entry - indicates senior lateral hiring

calc_3_broken_rung_detection.interpretation: NEGATIVE BROKEN RUNG - Women INCREASE at first promotion

severity_classification.classification: REVERSE PIPELINE - Likely due to lateral hiring of experienced women

calc_3_broken_rung_detection.key_insight: Entry-level has FEWER women (3.23%) than management (7.0%), suggesting GAIL hires experienced women laterally rather than promoting from within

obj_3_retention_broken_rung.key_insight: Retention is NOT the problem. Low female % at ALL levels suggests hiring problem at entry + possible lateral hiring at mid-level

gender_gap.interpretation: Women have PERFECT parental leave retention (100% return, 100% stay) - better than men

calc_5_auc_equity_score.description: Area Under Curve - Overall equity representation
calc_5_auc_equity_score.methodology: Sum of female percentages across all 5 tiers
calc_5_auc_equity_score.interpretation: Company achieves only 9.69% of ideal gender equity - WORST among all companies analyzed

normalized_weighted_index.interpretation: Weighted index slightly higher than AUC (10.45 vs 9.69) due to 7% at management vs 3.23% at entry

calc_7_bottleneck_tier_identification.description: Identify tiers with >10% drop in female representation

compensation_pay_equity_analysis.objective: Measure pay gaps at each level

board_of_directors.interpretation: Only male directors with remuneration data - insufficient female representation for comparison

key_management_personnel.interpretation: Zero female KMPs = no pay gap data

employees_other_than_bod_kmp.interpretation: Women employees earn 15.70% less than male employees - moderate gap

workers.interpretation: Women workers earn 20.39% less than male workers

wage_share_analysis.interpretation: Women are 7% of employees but receive only 6% of wages - underpaid by 1 percentage point

comparison_with_previous_companies.metric: GAIL vs TCS vs Sun Pharma

broken_rung_severity.ranking: UNIQUE - Reverse pipeline (women increase at management)

overall_auc_score.ranking: 3rd (worst by far) - 19.78 points behind Sun Pharma

comparison_with_previous_companies.verdict: GAIL has the WORST gender equity performance among all three companies analyzed, with critically low female representation at ALL levels

executive_summary.overall_verdict: CATASTROPHIC EQUITY FAILURE ACROSS ALL TIERS
key_findings: LOWEST female representation at entry (3.23%) among all companies analyzed
Management has 7.0% women - better than entry but still critically low
UNIQUE reverse pipeline: Women INCREASE from entry (3.23%) to management (7.0%)
Suggests lateral hiring of experienced women rather than internal promotion
C-Suite: 0% women (same failure as TCS and Sun Pharma)
Overall AUC Score: 9.69 (worst performance - Grade F)
Women are 7% of employees but receive only 6% of total wages
executive_summary.primary_strength: Perfect parental leave retention for women (100% return, 100% stay)
executive_summary.primary_weakness: Systemically low female hiring/representation at ALL levels, starting from entry (3.23%)
executive_summary.unique_pattern: Reverse pipeline (entry < management) suggests failure to hire women at entry level combined with token lateral hiring at mid-levels
recommended_interventions: URGENT: Institute 25-30% female hiring targets at entry level
Audit entry-level recruitment process for gender bias
Increase Board female representation to meet 33% mandate (currently only 7.14%)
Reserve at least 1 C-Suite position for qualified female candidate
Investigate why only 3.23% of entry-level hires are women in natural gas sector
Address wage share gap (7% employees but only 6% wages)
Create clear promotion pathways for the 7% women in management
Partner with engineering colleges to build female talent pipeline

sector_insight.gail_performance: Catastrophic failure - lowest female representation among all companies
sector_insight.sector_hypothesis: Traditional energy/heavy industry sectors (oil, gas, petrochemicals) have structural barriers to female entry

comparison_to_other_sectors.it_tcs: TCS has 36.8% at entry vs GAIL's 3.23% (11x better)
comparison_to_other_sectors.pharma_sun_pharma: Sun Pharma has 41.25% at entry vs GAIL's 3.23% (13x better)
comparison_to_other_sectors.insight: Energy sector appears to have the WORST gender diversity in India's corporate landscape
